title: What does ... operator do in JS?
answer_1: It is used to spread iterables to individual elements
answer_2: It is used to describe a datatype of undefined size
right_answer: It is used to spread iterables to individual elements

title: Which of the following methods is used to access HTML elements using Javascript?
When the switch statement matches the expression with the given labels, how is the comparison done?
answer_1: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.
answer_2: Only the datatype of the expression is compared.
answer_3: Only the value of the expression is compared.
right_answer: Both the datatype and the result of the expression are compared.

title: What keyword is used to check whether a given property is valid or not?
What is the use of the <noscript> tag in Javascript?
answer_1: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.
answer_2: Clears all the cookies and cache.
right_answer: The contents are displayed by non-JS-based browsers.

title: When an operator’s value is NULL, the typeof returned by the unary operator is:
What does the Javascript “debugger” statement do?
answer_1: It will debug all the errors in the program at runtime.
answer_2: It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
answer_3: It will debug error in the current statement if any.
right_answer: It acts as a breakpoint in a program.
